column1: Data Export Generated on Tue Jul 06 01:14:05 PDT 2021

column19: Hi there! Thank you very much for your time.We really appreciate it. Please please help us understand corporate behavior answering this short survey. We'd love to pay you for completing this task and will surely do it as long as you answer to the best of your knowledge. We know you will answer in this fashion as you are too cool to answer in a rush or not paying attention to the questions ;)
column20: Consent Form1.      What is the study about?You are invited to participate in a study of consumer behavior. We hope to learn how companies are perceivedby consumers after they engage in certain kinds of corporate behavior. Our intention is to understand someof the factors that influence these perceptions. To gain insights on these perceptions multiple-choice questionswill be asked about certain aspects of the behavior of the companies.Answers will then be analyzed to gain insights on how consumers perceive the companies.2.       Do I have to participate?Being part of this study is voluntary. If you want to be part of the study we ask that you read the information below carefully.You can read the information below and decide at the end if you do not want to participate.  3.       Who is being asked to participate?You have been asked to participate because:·         You are part of a society where contact with organizations is frequent. 4.       What will I be asked to do?If you want to take part in this study we will ask you to read a short vignette (or a set of them) and answer a short questionnaireregarding it (them). It will take around 10 minutes of your time to be part of this study. You will receive a compensation of 0.4 after completing the survey in its totality.5.       What are the benefits?The benefit of you taking part in this study is that you will contribute to research on consumer behavior. The expected benefits to society in general are a better understanding of how consumers think about organizations. 6.       What are the risks?With any study there are (1) risks we know about (2) risks we don’t know about and (3) risks we don’t expect.If you experience something that you aren’t sure about please contact us immediately so we can discuss the best way to manage your concerns.           Name: Luis Arango Email: laarangoso@unal.edu.co       We have listed the risks we know about below. This will help you decide if you want to be part of the study.·         You can experience some distress upon reading the description of the scenario(s).7.       What will happen to information about me?By clicking on the ‘I agree start questionnaire’ button this tells us you want to take part in the study.We will collect information about you in ways that will not reveal who you are.We will store information about you in ways that will not reveal who you are. We will publish information about you in ways that will not be identified in any type of publication from this study.We will keep your information indefinitely after the project is completed and might use it for future related projects.The data will be available publicly so that other researchers can replicate the findings.  Notice that no personal information that can identify you will be collected in this study. The personal information you provide will be handled in accordance with applicable privacy laws any health information collected will be handled in accordance with the Health Records Act 2001 (Vic). Subject to any exceptions in relevant laws you have the right to access and correct your personal information by contacting the research team.8.       Will I hear about the results of the study?We will let you know about the results of the study by email upon request to the principal investigator. Please consider that it can take several months before this research is published.9.       What if I change my mind?If you no longer want to complete the questionnaire simply close the web browser.If you change your mind after clicking on the ‘Submit’ button we cannot withdraw your responses because we cannot link who you are with your questionnaire responses. 10.    Who can I contact for questions or want more information?If you would like to speak to us please use the contact details below:Name: Luis Arango Email: laarangoso@unal.edu.co  Consent Form –Declaration by ParticipantI (the participant) have read understood the Participant Information Statement and any questions have been answered to my satisfaction. I agree to participate in the study I know I cannot withdraw my responses following the collection of my data but that I can abandon the survey at any point during the completion of it. I agree information provided by me or with my permission during the project may be included in a thesis presentation and published in journals on the condition that I cannot be identified. I also understand that my responses to the questionnaire will be part of a data set that will be publicly available and that the dataset can be used for any future studies.If you wish to receive a copy of the study results you can request it by contacting Mr Luis Alfredo Arango at laarangoso@unal.edu.co. The results are expected to be available around November 2022. This long period is due to the duration of academic journals’ peer-review processes.
column24: What is your highest degree or level of school you have completed?
column27: Please read carefully the following scenario as ALL the questions make reference to it: Crimson One is a gigantic foreign construction company with thousands of employees. Crimson One builds residential properties. The massive foreign company has been operating for over ten years and its financial situation is excellent with billion-dollar profits. One day Crimson One’s board decides to increase the company’s profits by employing cheaper materials to construct houses in low-income suburbs where it can go unnoticed. The strategy is a success for Crimson One and they decide to stick with it. However thousands of house owners and tenants are eventually impacted by the use of cheap materials and they later find themselves spending money on house maintenance and repairs.
column31: What do you think about the behavior of Crimson?
column32: You will be presented with some statements. Please choose your level of agreement with the statements using the options given.
column33: Here is a reminder of the scenario in case you need it. Please take into account that all the questions will make reference to it:  Crimson One is a gigantic foreign construction company with thousands of employees. Crimson One builds residential properties. The massive foreign company has been operating for over ten years and its financial situation is excellent with billion-dollar profits. One day Crimson One’s board decides to increase the company’s profits by employing cheaper materials to construct houses in low-income suburbs where it can go unnoticed. The strategy is a success for Crimson One and they decide to stick with it. However thousands of house owners and tenants are eventually impacted by the use of cheap materials and they later find themselves spending money on house maintenance and repairs.
column72: Please write a random six digit number (don't be predictable for example 123456" as this would be used to pay you). Please place the same code on Mturk when prompted."

column31: I think it’s terrible to cut corners and leave people in situations where they are impacted by the poor decisions.
The behavior of hiding cheaper materials in homes built in lower-income neighborhoods is unethical.
It is morally wrong since its shortcuts put its residents at risk and force them to pay for repairs.
I think its pretty shitty to do. They can afford to build good houses, but they dont because they can get away with it.
I THINK THIS COMPANYS BEHAVIOR IS VERY DECEITFUL AND UNETHICAL.
I believe their business practices to be unethical just to increase profits.

I think the behavior or Crimson is motivated by corporate Greed. It puts company profits above customer welfare. The company even displays deceptive tactics by attempting to hide their practice in certain neighborhoods.
This type of behavior is disturbing because not only does it lead to less profits in the long run, but when consumers understand how theyve been cheated it results in lawsuits.

I think it is disgusting that an already successful company could be so greedy that they would blatantly set up people of lower incomes to have issues in the future. For many people they are 1 paycheck away from homelessness which means that many people could not afford the kind of repairs that may be necessary.
I think the behavior is unacceptable, it’s unfair they are treating less fortunate people this way
I think it is unacceptable and selfish. Companies do not have to do things like that to be successful.

Crimson One behavior may turn to cost the company heavily because it is losing its integrity to serve the people with honesty and transparency.IT has a greedy and self centered agenda of making greater profits at the expense of unknowing customers.
They used cheaper made materials in order to make the cost cheaper.  This was their mistake.  I think that Crimson Co is a deceptive company and deserves whatever they get.
Thats not right for them to treat customers different. I think they should renew the contracts in the lower income areas.
Immoral

I think the behavior is very capitalistic and focuses only on the benefit of the company. It fails to realize the impact of the poor materials and the cost on society of wasted resources. The behavior should not be acceptable in a functioning society, but happens frequently and is not something that is surprising.

They are greedy and only thinks about their interest as evidenced by them prioritizing gaining profits by using cheaper materials to construct houses without considering the inconvenience and danger it can pose to residents.
I think its harmful and not a good way to do business. I think in the long run it might hurt them as they lose development contracts.
i think in the long term this would harm the company more than help
They are taking advantage of low income buyers by using shoddy materials.
I believe that it is irresponsible and only thinking about the profits.
It is immoral and shortsighted.  Its reputation will eventually suffer as a result.
I think it is morally wrong and unethical
Irresponsible and unethical, very immoral people. There is no excuse for taking advantage of the poorer people just to make a few extra bucks.
It is very unethical and greedy of them to do this.
IT WAS SHORT SIGHTED AND UNETHICAL
i think it kind of sucks and its greedy
It would be reprehensible if it were less common, so lets just call it pretty much standard.
I think its abhorrent. Putting lives at risk just to save a buck or two.
i think it is in appropriate for them to do it and immoral as well. I think they were already having a huge margin in profits so to use cheaper materials it is a direct result of their greed
The strategy of Crimson company is not acceptable
Morally impermissible
I believe it is common for businesses to do this, but being a company that can afford to keep places safe they should be ashamed
Pretty typical cooperate behavior

It seems unprofessional and lacks integrity to use lesser-quality materials to build homes for people living in lower income places. A construction business should give their best to every customer, not just those with money.
I think that its reprehensible!
Its unethical.
It was a selfish behavior.
Unethical company. They are only concerned with income.
Honestly I think that is an incredibly slimy business tactic.
Shady
They are trying to maximize profit at the expense of others.
Its trying to fool the consumer.
I think the behavior of Crimson is despicable, but not at all surprising in a large corporation. I think it is disrespectful of their customers, and greedy.

It is outrageous and wrong. The company is already making billions in profits and yet still wants more at the expense of poor people. Its the kind of story that illustrates corporate greed  and the need for stronger punishments for this sort of behavior.
Reprehensible and worthy of legal repercussions.
I think Crimson only thinks about profits and not its customers and its a very unethical company
They are cheap and greedy and dont care about the consumers.
its unethical to use cheaper materials to save costs.
I think it was immoral and irresponsible to treat people that trusted them that way, especially with something as important as housing.
I do not approve of their behavior and think that they will lose customers.
I dont think what they are doing is right, it is wrong to use cheaper materials and try to get away with it. It is unfair to house owners and tenants.
Not good
Very bad and unfair to the people who live in places they are using cheap materials on

Putting ethical issues aside, Crimson One is making a poor business decision. Even though the company will benefit in the short term by using cheaper materials, it will likely lose money over the long term. This is due to the fact that its customers (the people who buy the homes) will complain on social media--and in other places. The negative publicity will harm the companys brand.
Its deplorable, reprehensible, and immoral, but also typical of a big company in a capitalist ecosystem. It needs to be punished severely.
I feel like its a good company that has huge future success
It is wrong and immoral.
Typical.  Unfortunate.
I think they were once a successful and well-trusted company, but they have changed and became cheap and unreliable with their materials.
Theyre exploiting the poor and weak for monetary gain.

Its despicable.  Like too many other big businesses, they are driven by greed.  They want to make as much money as they can and they dont care about their customers.  Theyre even willing to deceive their neediest customers to increase their profits.  They should be shut down.

It is very greedy and unjust of them to use cheap materials for low-income areas. They are behaving poorly and maliciously. They are behaving despicably and dishonorably. They only care about their profits and dont care the lives of low income people.
I think it is horrible how they took advantage of the lower class for profit.
It is immoral and it is preying on people who are somewhat vulnerable. It is doing so for corporate greed.
I think it reprehensible for this company to use cheaper materials to make the homes. I believe that this would cause them to be unsafe in the long run.
They are being cheap and unethical.
I think they are really greedy and dont care about the welfare of low income people. They only care about their profits.
I think the behavior of Crimson one is unethical and bad for business
I think that it is very unethical and wrong. They are putting profits over people and quality.

I find them to be unethical. They know by reducing costs in order to keep more of the profit for themselves, the people that buy their houses will eventually be in a worse situation, due to poor materials used in construction, but they do not care. This is completely immoral behavior.
It is bad behavior
Although it is likely common for many companies to employ similar practices, it is still considerably unethical
I dont think it is right for them to use cheaper material to increase their profits.
It was bad and greedy and immoral. they prioritize their profits over the needs of many others.
I think they are a selfish company to pass on the expenses to people who cant afford them.
Deceitful and unfair. They didnt give families in low-income communities a fair infrastructure.
I think it is reprehensible.  I think that there is no defense for this kind of thing.  It is taking advantage of people who are already disadvantaged.

I think it should be considered criminal and the leadership of the company should go to prison for at least 20 years. I wouldnt mind if they were forced to payback everyone that purchased an inferior house from them. I also wouldnt mind if they were forced to do very difficult work in prison. They are horrible monsters that destroy lives and seriously impact the local economies, city planning, and the environment.
It is absolutely despicable and unethical. There should be some kind of way to punish the company for the lack of moral and common decency toward people.

I think the chose a higher profit margin over the quality of their products. There was no information given about their funding or their contracting........who they contracted for.. The information given was about the labor involved. It sounds like they are contracted out by the government.
I think it is unethical and they are taking advantage of the trust placed in them.

I do not think it is fair because they are costing people more money, yet making more money themselves. They should use sturdy and durable materials that last so people get what they pay for and do not have to lose money. It is wrong.

I think the behavior of Crimson lacks integrity. The actions demonstrate that they are only interested in their own financial gain rather than the benefit of its customers. They are taking advantage of people who are the most helpless and are easily hurt by poor construction standards. Crimson is demonstrating untrustworthiness and selfish ambition.
the behavior is unethical - and preys on the people who can afford it leas
Sketchy and cheap

I think the behavior displayed by Crimson is expected by corporations as they try to cut costs and increase profits, so in that way it is not surprising. At the same time, I think it is questionably ethically as it is causing additional costs for others and could even cause injury if too many corners are cut in the workmanship.
Typical corporate greed. They are completely selfish. Enough is never enough when it comes to money. Makes me sad and angry.
I think that their behavior is very unethical and cheap.
Not good
The behavior is not cool. You cannot use cheaper materials just to get more profits. They make house owners lives harder.
I think the behavior is awful and is bad business. It’s a shame to see a company take advantage of the lower income homes.
The behavior of Crimson is unethical. Its shameful. And it probably will go unnoticed in certain neighborhoods as opposed to those of affluence.
Their behavior is immoral and puts profits before the safety of those who live in their units.

Its unethical, but legal. Situations like this arise when there isnt enough regulation or when a company prioritized profits, especially when they can exploit lower-income individuals without fear of litigious reprisal.
I think its clearly unethical, as well as dangerous.
I think that it is bad and unethical. I think that they are a greedy company.
I think its immoral and will only hurt them in the long run. If I had a choice, I would most definitely not do business with them.

I think it is disgusting. Taking advantage of people who do not have a lot of money is despicable. They gained the trust of these people and made them feel happy about having homes, and then left them hurt and in trouble.

Crimsons behavior is immoral and indicative of an organization that only cares about profit. Crimson is willing to take a shortcut and deal with the consequences tomorrow. Crimson is not very afraid of risk. Crimson is calculating and ungenerous.

I think it is immoral for the construction company to substandard material/processes.  Their work should be quality even if the customer cannot see the results.  Your work reflects who you are and what you stand for.  Integrity goes a long way in any business.
I think it was very ambitious and tried to take advantage of the poor.  Disgraceful!
Its unethical and causes harm to many people. Its typical of a large corporation, whether domestic or international, to cut costs for short-term profits that in the long term harm its customers.
I think its unethical, and I dont support it.
The thing they did is not moral and ethical.

I think that building a house using cheap materials is a violation of the ethical consciousness of a company by a giant company that has enough money to make billions of dollars in profits. These corporate actions create a society that is more unstable and unreliable.
The company puts the public at risk

I think its deplorable that they would use cheaper materials in order to make more money. House quality has already dropped so much throughout the years, and they are just trying to make even lower quality homes and rip off lower income people who cant afford constant home repairs. I think they are a horrible company.
It is pretty egregious especially since it has been profitable all these years.
Undesirable for taking advantage of people.

I think the behavior is greedy and the outcome should have been expected. They tried to increase profits by using cheaper materials only to have to later fix the cheaper materials. Typical greed thing to happen.
Its despicable behavior.
I think their behavior is very deceptive and harmful to many people trying to own homes.  Lower income families end up having to pay for costly repairs that may not have a budget for.
Dishonest and shady

Crimson Ones behavior is immoral and unprofessional. They are cutting corners in order to make more money, which is not a good business model. They started out good but turned to cheap methods, which is costing people who own the homes they built lots of money in maintenance and repair.
I DO NOT LIKE IT. I THINK THEIR BEHAVIOR IS VERY SELFISH AND THEY ARE NOT THINKING ABOUT THE HOME OWNERS.
Crimson Ones deliberate--and overall hurtful--money grabbing scheme for low-income individuals is outrageous. They should be investigated for their practices.
Greedy. Unethical. Irresponsible. Taking advantage of vulnerable people.
This isnt good behavior, and hurts people who are already hurting.
Thats terrible behavior that is unethical and could cause homeowners to end up winning billions in lawsuits as a result
I think the behavior shows that they are very greedy and do not care about their customers.
it is bad. they are dishonest.
